verses.text: When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; when the wicked rule, the people groan.
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:3
rsbNotes.text:
29:3 makes his father glad. See 10:1; 28:7.

squanders his wealth. The parallelism implies that such behavior is a disgrace and a sorrow to oneâ€™s father (6:26).

verses.text: By justice a king gives a country stability, but one who is greedy for bribes tears it down.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:4
rsbNotes.text: 29:4 See 8:15, 16; 20:8, 26 and notes.
